lexUnit.name: bore.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel weary and uninterested by being dull and tedious

sentence.text: They bored me to death .
He was fond of her , although she bored him to death .
` Well , it bores me , " Mrs Sanderson retorted .
She stopped abruptly , perhaps fearing that she was boring me .
The sounds said , I need Glinwood , and he bores me .
Second , this was not a person who bored everyone by overearnestness .
I must have bored you out of your mind . "
French and Ukrainian , mathematics and chemistry bored him to the point of insanity ; only in music and English could he hope to get decent marks .
As a lover , he had bored her , but she liked the idea of his having to steel himself to visit her in the filthy venue she had chosen for their affair .
Success in love only bores her .
The truth was , Maud bored him .
I always found this kind of slick psychoanalytic one-upmanship irritating , but I never attempted to defend myself , because I am bored by argument and discussion of any kind .
Well , I was bored by the whole of presentation as far as television was concerned because I think television is bound to be superficial .
If your child finds reading difficult , do n't provide books aimed at younger children because he may be bored by them even though he can understand them .
1988 The fact that Diana is bored by Charles 's polo obsession is now common knowledge and , significantly , the kiss on the mouth has now been reduced to a mere peck on the cheek .
I was only listening because I was bored .
Perhaps they were bored too , but whatever the reason the Met girls were always in trouble for one reason or another .
The thing with Minneapolis was that everyone was bored to tears , so we just made a scene . "
Big fellow with a Jimmy Edwards tash and a red face , swaying slightly as he bores all around him with a pack of lies about his past .
Other people 's lives bored him and he became sharp and irritable on the one occasion Lucien tried to impart some interesting snippet of information Azmaveth had told him .
